alert.note: Alert for Cedar (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 3:31PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Scott, western Clinton, southwestern Jackson, northeastern Muscatine, eastern Cedar and southeastern Jones Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 331 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lost Nation to near Durant. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, minor flooding and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Slowing or redirecting of traffic due to ponding or flowing water. Closure of waterfront access due to flooding. Locations impacted include... Muscatine, Maquoketa, Durant, Walcott, Blue Grass, Buffalo, Lowden, Wheatland, Grand Mound, Delmar, Lost Nation, Calamus, Monmouth, Toronto, Hurstville, Montpelier, Nashville, Fairport, Dixon, and Stockton. This includes Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 274 and 287. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
